channel.title: Why don't prayer/skull icons above heads work in 317 deobs?
channel.description: Well I know that they don't work because a lot of people have told me and when trying to use them in my server I get errors in my client, but why is this? If I rewrote the server for a later deob would it work? Post here if you have any ideas thx. :)

item.title: Why don't prayer/skull icons above heads work in 317 deobs?
item.dc:creator: @xerozcheez xerozcheez
item.description:
@xerozcheez wrote:

[quote=“wL, post:6, topic:3583”][quote author=xerozcheez link=topic=4317.msg43211#msg43211 date=1149364327]
Well I know that they don’t work because a lot of people have told me and when trying to use them in my server I get errors in my client, but why is this? If I rewrote the server for a later deob would it work? Post here if you have any ideas thx.
[/quote]
It’s because you use data files from a newer version which are not 100% compatible to 317. At some point there was a change in the head icon files, but I don’t remeber at which version the change was. So either you use a 317 cache, port the server to a new client or backport the changes to the 317 client.[/quote]

Oh yeah of course I never thought about that, I have a 317 cache somewhere I’ll try it out thanks

Read full topic
item.source: Why don't prayer/skull icons above heads work in 317 deobs?

item.title: Why don't prayer/skull icons above heads work in 317 deobs?
item.dc:creator: @wL1 wL
item.description:
@wL1 wrote:

xerozcheez:

Well I know that they don’t work because a lot of people have told me and when trying to use them in my server I get errors in my client, but why is this? If I rewrote the server for a later deob would it work? Post here if you have any ideas thx.

It’s because you use data files from a newer version which are not 100% compatible to 317. At some point there was a change in the head icon files, but I don’t remeber at which version the change was. So either you use a 317 cache, port the server to a new client or backport the changes to the 317 client.

Read full topic
item.source: Why don't prayer/skull icons above heads work in 317 deobs?

item.title: Why don't prayer/skull icons above heads work in 317 deobs?
item.dc:creator: @xerozcheez xerozcheez
item.description:
@xerozcheez wrote:

[quote=“Dizzy, post:4, topic:3583”]Maybe it’s client side and not server side. Or, the most obvious and dumb sounding, both. :eek:
Like, the server sais, “Hey, this guy is killing this guy. Give that bastard a skull you tard.” And the client goes, “Ok, ok! Don’t abuse me like that anymore! Our relationship is through!” Server: “I don’t care! I’ll have a new relationship next update!” … Ook… I guess that was SOMEWHAT a good example.

Or, a easier way to understand: When a player attacks another player in the wilderness, the server sends a packet to the user’s client telling the client to use this graphics thing or whatever. So then the client turns on the skull or something like that. But then it’s serverside if the other player can see it, so I’m confused now…[/quote]

lololol, nah xd, it’s clientside, and I think it’s to do with loading from the cache cos remember when i was messin around and got mod icons on mini map? When I tried to add prayer icons to mini map by simply changing it from loading mod icons to pray icons, it crashed =, but it can’t be the cache cos I tried quite a few and they can’t all be buggy xd

Read full topic
item.source: Why don't prayer/skull icons above heads work in 317 deobs?

item.title: Why don't prayer/skull icons above heads work in 317 deobs?
item.dc:creator: @Dizzy Dizzy
item.description:
@Dizzy wrote:

Maybe it’s client side and not server side. Or, the most obvious and dumb sounding, both. :eek:
Like, the server sais, “Hey, this guy is killing this guy. Give that bastard a skull you tard.” And the client goes, “Ok, ok! Don’t abuse me like that anymore! Our relationship is through!” Server: “I don’t care! I’ll have a new relationship next update!” … Ook… I guess that was SOMEWHAT a good example.

Or, a easier way to understand: When a player attacks another player in the wilderness, the server sends a packet to the user’s client telling the client to use this graphics thing or whatever. So then the client turns on the skull or something like that. But then it’s serverside if the other player can see it, so I’m confused now…

Read full topic
item.source: Why don't prayer/skull icons above heads work in 317 deobs?

item.title: Why don't prayer/skull icons above heads work in 317 deobs?
item.dc:creator: @xerozcheez xerozcheez
item.description:
@xerozcheez wrote:

[quote=“Dizzy, post:2, topic:3583”]Think of it… 317… That almost sounds like a beta version of runescape.
I think the skull is a magicID thing for private servers. So maybe you should start looking for it by typing ::magicid or whatever you do to test them.[/quote]

Lol, 317 is not that long ago…about only nearly a year ago, and the skull is part of the player appearance update mask, I know for sure.

Read full topic

Think of it… 317… That almost sounds like a beta version of runescape.
I think the skull is a magicID thing for private servers. So maybe you should start looking for it by typing ::magicid or whatever you do to test them.
